body.head: Manuscript Contents
body.p: The contents of each manuscript part should be given into the smallest possible unit (msPart) to which they refer to, into an msContent, but they can be added at any level in a hierarchy of parts.

msItem.note: Each sentence is translated continuously to Amharic.

body.p: title should point with a ref to the identifier of the Work in the Clavis. In the Work file alternative titles in different languages should be given, here the title should be reported if relevant, e.g. if non standard.

div.head: Summary
div.p: msContents can contain a summary of the contents, but these can be structurally described with nested msItems.
You do not have to give this summary, because a summary will be built from the app starting from msItems.

div.head: msItem
div.p: msItem will hold information about contents of the manuscript.

msItem.incipit: እሴብሕ፡ ጸጋኪ፡ ኦምልዕተ፡ ጸጋ፡ ወእትጋነይ፡ ለኪ፨ ኦምልዕተ፡ ውዳሴ፡ ተዘከርኩ፡ በልሌሊት፡ ንጽሐ፡ ድንግልናኪ፡
msItem.explicit: ኦእግዚእየ፡ ኢየሱስ። ክርስቶስ፨ ዕቀበኒ፡ እመክረ፨ ሥጋ፨ ወነፍስ፡ ለገብርከ፨ ገብርከ፡ ረ፨ ማርያም፨ አሜን፡ ስብሀት፡ ለኪ፡ ማርም፡ በኁ

div.p: One msItem can have more than one locus (see specific page on the use of locus), for instance in composite mss:
If the text of an incipit, explicit, or addition which is quoted in the catalogue record contains text in verse, do use lb with a progressive number in n for each line.

egXML.incipit:
ኦእግዚአብሔር፡ ጥበበ፡ ጠቢባን፡ ከሃሊ።
እስከ፡ ለዓለም፡ እምጥንት፡ እንተ፡ ኢትበሊ።
ድኩመ፡ ሕሊና፡ ገብርከ፡ ወፈራሃ፡ ልብ፡ ኢተሃባሊ።
እስመ፡ ኀቤከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ ጸሎተ፡ አድኅኖ፡ እጼሊ።
አድኅነኒ፡ አድኅነኒ፡ እምኵሉ፡ ቀታሊ።

div.head: Title
div.p: title will point to a univocally identified work, for msItems which correspond to an identifiable work or can be identified as a work. The ID of the work will be given in a ref and it can be looked up in the list or search pages of the app, by ID, if that is known, or by title.
you can use type to give information about the completeness of the text.

div.head: Rubric
div.p: rubric contains the text of any rubric (heading or subheading) attached to a particular manuscript item. This should not be confused with rubrication, see Text Encoding and Hand Description.

div.head: Incipit and Explicit
div.p: incipit and explicit will contain a locus and the original text directly within the element. Their language should always be specified, even if identical to the one given in textLang. Translations of the text will have to be into a foreign specifying the language of the translation. More than one translation can be added.
Within the text all TEI markup can be used to indicate mistakes, lacunas, editorial interventions, etc.
The use of explicit follows the TEI definition.
Subscriptions stating that the text is completed, which have not been added later to the text, are encoded as explicit type="subscription":

egXML.explicit: ተፈጸመ፡ ነገር፡ ዘጦቢት፡ ወጦቢያ፡ ወልዱ፡፡ በረከቶሙ፡ ትኲን፡ ምስለ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ኢያሱ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡፡ አሜን፡፡

div.p: Similarly, supplications written at the same time as the main text should be encoded, depending on their location in the text, as incipit type="supplication" or explicit type="supplication".

div.head: Musical notation
div.p: Information about musical notation can be given in notatedMusic

div.head: msItem for contents of a work
div.p: You can also nest into a msItem other msItems which describe part of a work. If the content is partial, you can use defective with the value true. Default is false and is not encoded.
